name: 5-butyl-5-ethylbarbituric acid
Reason: 5-butyl-5-ethylbarbituric acid has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is barbituric acid, which has a melting point of around 100 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in 5-butyl-5-ethylbarbituric acid will affect its melting point: (1) The two phenyl groups can add approximately +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure; (2) The ethyl group can add roughly +5 due to the increase in molecular volume and the presence of a hydroxyl group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding; (3) The methyl group can add approximately +2 due to the increase in molecular volume and the presence of a hydroxyl group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding; (4) The butyl group can add roughly +5 due to the increase in molecular volume and the presence of a hydroxyl group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
